thread.title: Extreme in effect in |
thread.title_full: Extreme cold weather alert in effect in Toronto | Toronto Star

author: Fakiha Baig Staff Reporter
title: Extreme in effect in |
text:
One day after freezing rain caused chaos in the city , Torontonians are being asked to brace for more unpleasant weather. The remainder of the week will be a frigid one as the city faces an extreme cold weather alert issued by Toronto’s health official on Wednesday.
The alert comes a day after the city was drizzled with freezing rain that made for icy conditions all across the GTA, delaying commutes and resulting in  power outages.
Extreme cold weather alerts   reach -15 C or colder.
Environment Canada’s forecast for Toronto Wednesday calls for temperatures around 0 C that will feel more like -6 C  
  In the evening, temperatures of around -5 C will feel like -12 C with the wind chill and drop to  -13 C overnight — a nostril-sticking -16 C  
On Thursday, Torontonians are reminded to bundle up. Forecast temperatures around  -10 C temperatures will actually feel like -16 C  
There’s also a 30 per cent chance of flurries Thursday night.
The bone-chilling temperatures will continue on Friday as well as temperatures reach a low of -11 C  
But by Saturday, temperatures are expected to warm up a bit.
Environment Canada is reporting a warm weekend as Saturday jumps to a high jump of 8 C with a 40 per cent chance of showers. Nighttime temperatures will be at a low of -3 C.
All of Sunday, temperatures will remain at a high of 5 C.
 
“Extreme
